subject: Fashion
title: Color Trends and Collective Mood
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Color Trends and Collective Mood.

hook.text: After 9/11, fashion went darkâ€”black, gray, navy. After lockdowns, neon and bright colors surged.

buildup.text: Color analysts track world events, believing collective trauma and hope both show up in what people wear.

discovery.text: During economic downturns, muted earth tones spike. In recovery periods, bold primaries take over.

twist.text: It's a chicken-and-egg loop: do we pick colors from mood, or do brands just sell us the mood?

climax.text: Color trends work as an emotional weather reportâ€”a visible signal of how society collectively feels.

punchline.text: Society's mood has a color. Fashion reads the room.

quiz.question: What typically happens to fashion color palettes during economic downturns?
options: Bright neon colors surge as people seek escapism and joy
Muted earth tones spike in popularity while bold colors decline
Color trends remain stable because they are set years in advance
